description: Couchbase Model Context Protocol Server to interact with Couchbase clusters

lifecycle.reason: Missing required package metadata (runtimeHint or identifier)

name: io.github.Couchbase-Ecosystem/mcp-server-couchbase

environmentVariables.description: Couchbase connection string. Required for connecting to the cluster.
environmentVariables.name: CB_CONNECTION_STRING

environmentVariables.description: Couchbase database username. Required for basic authentication.
environmentVariables.name: CB_USERNAME

environmentVariables.description: Couchbase database password. Required for basic authentication.
environmentVariables.name: CB_PASSWORD

environmentVariables.description: Couchbase CA certificate path. Required for TLS authentication in non Capella clusters.
environmentVariables.name: CB_CA_CERT_PATH

environmentVariables.description: Couchbase client certificate path. Required for mTLS authentication.
environmentVariables.name: CB_CLIENT_CERT_PATH

environmentVariables.description: Couchbase client key path. Required for mTLS authentication.
environmentVariables.name: CB_CLIENT_KEY_PATH

environmentVariables.description: Couchbase read only mode. Set to true to allow disable write operations across both KV and query. KV write tools are not loaded and SQL++ queries that modify data are blocked. Set to false to allow data modification queries and tools.
environmentVariables.name: CB_MCP_READ_ONLY_MODE

environmentVariables.description: [Deprecated] Couchbase read only query mode. Set to true to allow only read-only queries. Set to false to allow data modification queries. Use CB_MCP_READ_ONLY_MODE instead.
environmentVariables.name: CB_MCP_READ_ONLY_QUERY_MODE

environmentVariables.description: Transport mode for the server (stdio, http or sse). Default is stdio
environmentVariables.name: CB_MCP_TRANSPORT

environmentVariables.description: Host to run the MCP server on (default: 127.0.0.1). Used only for HTTP and SSE transport modes.
environmentVariables.name: CB_MCP_HOST

environmentVariables.description: Port to run the MCP server on (default: 8000). Used only for HTTP and SSE transport modes.
environmentVariables.name: CB_MCP_PORT

environmentVariables.description: Tools to disable. Accepts comma-separated tool names (e.g., 'tool_1,tool_2') or a file path containing one tool name per line.
environmentVariables.name: CB_MCP_DISABLED_TOOLS

packageArguments.description: Couchbase connection string. Required for connecting to the cluster.
packageArguments.name: --connection-string

packageArguments.description: Couchbase database username. Required for basic authentication.
packageArguments.name: --username

packageArguments.description: Couchbase database password. Required for basic authentication.
packageArguments.name: --password

packageArguments.description: Couchbase CA certificate path. Required for TLS authentication in non Capella clusters.
packageArguments.name: --ca-cert-path

packageArguments.description: Couchbase client certificate path. Required for mTLS authentication.
packageArguments.name: --client-cert-path

packageArguments.description: Couchbase client key path. Required for mTLS authentication.
packageArguments.name: --client-key-path

packageArguments.description: Couchbase read only mode. Set to true to disable write operations across both KV and query. KV write tools are not loaded and SQL++ queries that modify data are blocked. Set to false to allow data modification queries and tools.
packageArguments.name: --read-only-mode

packageArguments.description: [Deprecated] Couchbase read only query mode. Set to true to allow only read-only queries. Set to false to allow data modification queries. Use --read-only-mode instead.
packageArguments.name: --read-only-query-mode

packageArguments.description: Transport mode for the server (stdio, http or sse). Default is stdio
packageArguments.name: --transport

packageArguments.description: Host to run the MCP server on (default: 127.0.0.1). Used only for HTTP and SSE transport modes.
packageArguments.name: --host

packageArguments.description: Port to run the MCP server on (default: 8000). Used only for HTTP and SSE transport modes.
packageArguments.name: --port

packageArguments.description: Tools to disable. Accepts comma-separated tool names (e.g., 'tool_1,tool_2') or a file path containing one tool name per line.
packageArguments.name: --disabled-tools
